intro: Andrachne australis, commonly known as the Australian sandmat, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its mat-forming growth habit and hairy, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in spring, typically along the stems. It thrives in sandy or well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Andrachne australis is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
